isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - GENERAL INFORMATION - 1992 - 1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING - DATA LINK WIRING

svcproc.title: DATA LINK WIRING
svcproc.para: All wires for the data link system have a 98 circuit wire number. Electrical polarity is important within the engine control system. Each data link wire number has a suffix of (+) or (-) to indicate polarity. It is important that (+) wires are connected only to other (+) wires, and (-) wires are connected only to other (-) wires. The (-) indicates polarity and does not imply a connection to ground.

Data link wires can be spotted quickly in a harness since they are a pair of twisted wires. To maintain the integrity of the communications system it is important that all data link wiring is twisted pair wiring (12 full twists per foot).

To make connections to the data bus easier, International Truck uses color coded "data link bus connectors" on all models. Two connectors, located behind the instrument panel, connect all data link wires ( Figure 6.02). The red data link bus connects all (+) data link wires, and the blue data link bus connects all (-) data link wires. Each engine control system includes connector composites for the particular configuration of the Data Link connectors.
Chapters II through V contain specific information on each engine control system.
